TopicTitle: "Plan Kappa" - A KSP graphic novel (Jeb is back in Chapter 53! Well, kinda.)

Articles.Content:
This reminded me of Babylon 4...perhaps it is being sent back to help?

Looking forward to the next chapter!

Oh great. Now that thing is going to try to talk to the now extinct Humpback Whales and start boiling the oceans and messing things up real good.

(Star Trek IV reference)
Kraken using your save as a sort of hoard?

Managed to squeeze yet another chapter before going out of town! Here it is:

I'll try to follow the thread if I get wi-fi on my phone, but will only be back at my PC by Saturday. Have a nice week, everyone!

Great development! And now I remember this from the first post:

5. All Ã¢â‚¬Å“rescueÃ¢â‚¬Â missions must be accepted. ThereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s going to be an in-story reason for that.

Very nice and unique in-story explanation for this phenomenon. Also I love the ground crew guy--that little aside added another level to the main characters. Enjoy your break! I'll post some stuff tomorrow so folks can get their comix fix

Excellent work once again.

I'm enjoying the ride. (Unlike Bob ).

Happy landings!

This is turning out to be awesome!

Great story telling!

Can't wait to see what (or who) is there!
Back from the hiatus:
Dun dun dun....

Beautiful work!

I am so intrigued.

Happy landings!
"We did not...yet." Now thats the words able to send a wave of chills down any sci-fi fan back. Rarely anything good happens after that.

Lots of great stuff here--the design of the 'escape pods' in the K2 station makes perfect sense for the presence of rescue-able kerbonauts, and now we have a wonderfully scifi time loop, reminds me a bit of some of my favorite ST:TNG episodes. Glad to have you back, keep it coming!
Looks like we're in for an interesting time loop here! Just make sure Glery doesn't find out about her future self being back in time!

Is a paradox going to happen when past Glery meets future Glery?

Then again, the future (Glery's past) is changed already, so......
Ow, my head.
Sorry Kuzzter but this is SO MUCH MORE INTRGEING than Duna ore bust and Eve order 0.

Sorry Kuzzter but this is SO MUCH MORE INTRGEING than Duna ore bust and Eve order 0.

I find myself agreeing with you. I'd fall for wibbly-wobbly timey-wimey stuff any day of the week.

'Course, E:O0 and D,OB have a completely different plot line and I still love them both.

Sorry Kuzzter but this is SO MUCH MORE INTRGEING than Duna ore bust and Eve order 0.

Thanks for the input! If you don't mind I'll just keep on writing anyway, as well as supporting Parkaboy's outstanding work

I find myself agreeing with you. I'd fall for wibbly-wobbly timey-wimey stuff any day of the week.

'Course, E:O0 and D,OB have a completely different plot line and I still love them both.

Well, I guess we can't really compare, since I'm going for a slightly different genre here. Kuzzter's stories are way more funny and adventure focused, while mine perhaps has a higher dose of mystery. They're similar in format, but have different flavors. And since reading them is free, you may as well enjoy all of them!

Surely we can't compare two stories just because they are both comics? That's like comparing a Tesla Model S with a Renault Twizzy just because they are both electric...oh wait, they did actually print a comparison of those two vehicles...

Anyway, my point is both stories are awesome in their own right.

For the record, the Twizzy is NOT awesome... so maybe that wasn't the best comparison...

My mind turned into a LFO tank, and spontaneously exploded.

This is some spooky stuff!

Surely we can't compare two stories just because they are both comics? That's like comparing a Tesla Model S with a Renault Twizzy just because they are both electric...oh wait, they did actually print a comparison of those two vehicles...

Anyway, my point is both stories are awesome in their own right.

For the record, the Twizzy is NOT awesome... so maybe that wasn't the best comparison...

Well, technically you can compare them. What I meant is that a story is good if it succeeds at what it's trying to do, and we can't really judge it by the standards of a different type of story. I don't think Eve: Order Zero is trying to be intriguing, so we can't fault it for being less intriguing than Plan Kappa, and it certainly isn't less interesting because of it. Sure you can like one more than the other, but that's more because you like one flavor/genre more than the other than a measure of the value of the story. I think Kuzzter's stories are very good at what they set out to do, and can only hope that Plan Kappa will be as good at what it's trying to do, which is something a bit different.

I have also received a vision of the future!

"So our mission is clear. For the sake of the planet, and all kerbalkind... we must find this 'Danny2462', and stop him."
Chapter 7 is here!

Will they respawn back?
